content:
Posted: December 29, 2016
nukes-viewHi all, nukes here.Castle Crashers is a 2D side scrolling hack and slash adventure. Easy to pick up and play, I enjoyed playing this game solo and online with friends (up to 4 players).This game is very well put together and the developers have a knack for 2D side scrolling games. Great humour and art styles with a variety of musical artists creating great music for each level.The Game PlaySimple side scrolling game (works best with a controller)with great combo's and intuitive magic system. Simple levelling system and many different characters you can unlock, items you can find and pets you can make love you.DifficultyThe difficulty is pretty straight forward but not restricting there is a harder difficulty that you can unlock after completion, which can be found on the map after the first boss. Can only be done with same character.Controls & InterfaceGeared towards playing with a controller but not limited, as keyboard can work just as well.I just found it much easier with controller.AchievementsThis game has simple and fun achievements that are relatively easy to get and nothing that you would lose sleep over.StoryYou play a knight out to save the princess's and to defeat a dark evil wizard, on your journey you will encounter many hardships. Be brave young knight.Combat System The combat system is simple and fun revolving around a hack slash method with great combos that are given to you along your journey through levelling up.Magic spells are also learnt in the same way which can sway the battle in your favour.Pet companions can also be found throughout, used to give your character unique perks or advantages in battle that can help on your quest.Got to love RammyLevelingSimple levelling system that lets you place points into four attributes that increase your characters stats.The magic spells, can be quite different per character and all have great uses. Try out different characters to find the spells that suit you. Sounds & EffectsThe music for this game was composed by a variety of different artists and I found some of the music to be great and even downloaded a few of them myself from NewGrounds[www.newgrounds.com]for freeFavourite has to be this one but it isn't listed in the list.GraphicsThe graphics are simplistic but I found them very pleasing and suiting to the game. Cut ScenesI found the cut scenes well thought-out and funny, got to love the ending of the cyclops.Humour & TriviaI loved the humour of this game it is brilliant and suited for all ages and retains the same style throughout.MultiplayerThis game has a fantastic multiplayer that lets you play co operatively with friends either locally or online. Castle Crashers offers a small range of fun multiplayer modes where you can go up against friends in a fighting, feeding frenzy and good old volley ball real man's game.Bugs - ImportantNo bugs or issues were found.ConclusionI loved Castle Crashers and would happily go back to it if my friends asked, overall fun and great entertainment for all ages.Great to play with guests or friends at home.Easy to pick up and play and then just walk away if needed.I would say the only downside to this game is, that lately the online community has dwindled, best to play with friends.I will be keeping a close eye on the developers to see if they have any future releases planned as I really do like their style of games.Hope I helped.ηυĸєΜ266

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 10, 2014
												The game is fun - especially with friends! So don't think I don't like this game. It's got a hefty amount of clever jokes that aren't too far shoved in your face (like I noticed Ceiling Cat watching me from above in the pet store). But the controls for this game are... to put it gently... relatively poor.It recommends an Xbox controller, but it's a PC game so it should assume the majority of people will play it using a mouse and keyboard. It translates it's controls as though you're using an Xbox controller first off - something that was a really bad sign to me at first - but the real thing that crimps the controls is the fact you have to hold some buttons and tap others to activate this or that action. Your starting spell for instance is simply "Hold Shift, press Strong-Attack" while the bolt version of it would be "Hold Shift, Press Use-Item". Even then to cast spells in the air you have to use different buttons (Strong-Attack or Use-Item) to decide if you shoot horizontally or downwards which is just feels off (why not just let the movement keys press the direction you want to aim?). The fact that you can't even seperate the Item, magic, and the melee commands makes it bug♥♥♥♥ disorienting. It's a keyboard: It has enough buttons to cover the actions without having to resort to playing Twister with your fingers.That said I can't say I've played it and not had a blast yet. Granted I've only been playing it a couple of days so far. It's by no means an easy game, but it's a fun one.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 19, 2016
												Played it for many hours at first on Xbox 360 and some time after, at some sale, started to play it again on PC. I can say for sure that Castle Crashers is one of most interesting beat 'em up games I have ever played. Graphics might look like some kind of game for kind but don't be mistaken - kids, teenagers, adults, everyone will have great time playing this game. With so many characters (few at start, many to unlock) to play, so many levels to make, many weapons and secrets to find, you won't be bored after beating once, or twice, or until you will reach max level with every character. You can enjoy it alone, or with friends on 1 PC or over internet. Castle Crashers isn't not only filled with action, but also with humour, and what's better, the one that will for sure make you laught, unless you take everything too serious. Sure, some people will say it get's boring quickly or it's repetitive but if you ask me, I didn't get bored even once in those 50 (at the moment I'm making this review) hours. And I'm sure I will play it at some point again, and again, and again... and again. It's really easy to get addicted to this game.In my opinion, it's worth full price but sure, there are people who might not know what Castle Crashers is, or what kind of people made this game. If you are fan of beat 'em up games, then you must grab it at sale. Look at the number of reviews this game have received, and look at what number of those are positives ones - there is high chance that another positive review will be coming from you.

content:
Posted: October 7, 2014
												It's Castle Crashers... seriously? Where have you been living the past 5 years if you aren't even remotely aware of this title by now?This game basically has a perfect mix of brawler and RPG elements with optional 4 player co-op. Plenty of secrets to find and gear to collect. Juvenile humor is abound and plentiful. Great soundtrack as well. Brought to you from the artists over at Newgrounds.com.My only  real complaint about the game is that there are way too many characters to unlock and the amount of content is limited... too many clones of characters, not enough diversity, makes the game a bit stale over time. By the third playthrough it gets pretty obnoxious having to repeat the entire game over again instead of just allowing you to select your favorite stages.I wish they would of added more levels or an extra mode that allows you to unlock / level your characters without having to replay the entire story line over again. I mean once or twice is enough... you can't really skip cut scenes either which adds to the annoyance factor. Other than that, it's a great game to play with some friends.

content:
Posted: December 31, 2013
												I am so glad that this game was on sale. Because if it weren't for the sale I wouldn't be able to come across with such an enjoyable game. It has both humor and action in it. Not to mention the awesome combat style. What I observed in this game, however, it tries to put you to a class like ''take this stick, increase your intelligence and be a mage!'' but being a mage is not really powerful in the game. You end up using your ''stick'' in melee combat and go with it. There could be more options if only the game allowed it, such as being an archer if there were more types of bows. But then again these do not change the enjoyment of the game. I do not yet had the time to play it with my friends but I'm sure that it'd be even more fun like it is possible. And you can have cute pets with nice perks!All in all I just cannot stop playing this game. Both for the funny storyline and the great combat style.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 31, 2014
												Great fun game for the whole family, or just good 4 player sidecroller to mash enemies with your friends. TONS of unlockable characters, and a relatively easy achievement list to 100% if you are an achievement hunter. The DLC packs are cheap and totally great adding two extra Characters, The Blacksmith and The Pink Knight.Insanity mode after game completion offers a new difficulty to play through increasing the amount of playability and extending the level grinding to a more enjoyable and challenging setting. The artwork is great as well. It is very colorful and family friendly. The Game is playable by all ages (with a few poop and fart jokes in the mix).I also like that with my Xbox 360 Wireless Receiver for Windows I am able to hook up more than one controller and allow more than 1 player/controller to be supported by a single USB port and play/level multiple characters at once as my friends can choose my other characters and level along with me.Also available on the Playstation Network and Xbox Market. I would certainly recommend this game to anyone and everyone. Loads of enjoyment, replayability, and good laughs.10/10

number of helpful: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 7, 2013
												An extremely fun side scrolling, beat'em up, co-op rpg.  While it is nothing that  we haven't all seen before,  Castle Crashers executes all aspects of this  type of game perfectly.   Each character, do to color coordination, is easily identifiable.  Unique special abilities help each player  stand apart, as well as weapon choices, secondary items and companions that add passive abilities and stats.There is an rpg aspect that allows each player to upgrade his or her character's stats separately from the rest.  The enemies are well balanced as well as each type possessing its own attacks and abilities.  Almost every level has a boss at the end.Similar to Diablo, you can play back through after completion for a greater challenge.  I recommend having 4 players when you do this; otherwise, the game might begin to feel off balance.The game as a whole offers solid game play, good re-playability, fun co-op and many laughs.  A good buy if you plan on playing with a group of friends.Note: there  is a bit of lag when using the keyboard; the game is built around the game pad.


Castle Crashers 
A Screenshot of Castle Crashers
By: Vash(88)

												If you don't own this game... BUY IT. Literally one of my favorite games ever, and it's pretty simplistic. Posted: June 22, 2014
												Don't be fooled by it saying I've barely played this, I've clocked innumerable hours on the Xbox 360 version.Probably one of the most fun multiplayer co-op games ever created, filled with magnificent tongue-in-cheek humor that pokes fun at the whole hack and slash genre, Castle Crashers is totally worth the buy (so much I bought it twice!)  If you're thinking "but it looks so cheesy" then you need to find someone that has it, and play it for 15 minutes.  I guarantee you'll be wanting it in your collection as well after that.Tons of replayability, with a gajillion easter eggs to find and a diverse collection of characters to pick from, it's pretty easy to want to jump right in again from the beginning seconds after finishing off the final boss.But you don't have to take my word for it!

This is the arcade game that every guy searching for some new things should try.I want to say gameplay basics are nearly complete, you can find some small bugs but nothing big, it's smooth and you can surely tell, that the designers have spent hours on this.Gameplay through can maybe sometimes be a little too simple as you can just smash your keyboard to the table and kill enemys, but at least they have made it nearly impossible just too boost each other because of you need to kill the enemys, and as longer into you go the monsters getting much harder to kill, so you cant just let a lvl 1 guy into a high level area.I do also really like their way of humour through characters you can play as since you can get some really funny and quite suspicious crazy homour like a knight that casts rainbows, and shoots penguins as spells i find the characters really fullfilled, through the lvling process could be a little more creative since it gets a little long in the end.Storyline is complety sick♥♥♥♥♥fun homour, as always as in a standard adventure game you need to rescue the princess, but in difference for many other games they have found a way to make it more funny, like the bosses are not just simple but also a funny sarcastic, like a cat-shark it's quite funny since cats dont like water.

Posted: August 12, 2014
												A classic from The Behemoth that is just so good, people defecate before you character can even swing his/her weapon. Another non biased review despite my enjoyment of The Behemoth game. I re-bought this game after I completed it on my Ps3 and it was just as good... with the exception of volleyball replacing that horrid button-masher "All You Can Queef(af)" not included on the Steam version. The gameplay is sort of rough around the edges but is still a pretty good contribution to the beat-em-up genre. The game is also 4-player co-op fun that could be played on one computer/system or online (something that is lacking in the game community now a days pertaining to local co-op). It's a pretty fun game and it's only flaws are the occasional bugs and some online issues. It's an indie game on top of the second game this company has pushed out so don't get all in your feelings if you lag out of a game. It's really good quality for a game that came out in 2008 and sort-of remastered in 2010. CC is also very addicting because if your like me and want to unlock all the characters then your going to have to playthrough like no other game. You may be sick of repeating the game on top of playing the newly unlock insane mode for even more characters but it will be worth it in the end (maybe not). CC is an all around fun game brought to you by Newgrounds and I'd just wish the son from Dad n' Me and the troll were characters.  An all around good time with your friends and an awesome indie expirience. This game is 9.99/10 (Those bugs can get annoying). *On a side note you should also check out BattleBlock Theater (Steam Version of course) and Alien Hominid (On Console Only)*

Posted: November 30, 2016
												From my experience playing as Green -> Gray, I can tell this game is all the types of awesome combined into one legendary package with sandwiches and knights.So we have our basic Knights, Red Knight aka Darth Sidious. We have Blue Knight aka Phantom Blood Dio, Green Knight or Diarrhea Knight and Orange Knight.You can choose these 4 knights at the start of the game and by completing the game with a certain knight, Beating a certain level to get Gray Knight or the Alien Hominid, or by spending a few minutes in the Arena.I won't get too into the story but the knights party in the barracks behind/underneath the Throne Room, A gray knight gets dead and gets thrown into the party, Everyone stops and gets triggered, Kills some Barbarians and then the princesses get captured...All 4 of them...If you're playing with friends, When you get to saving the Orange Princess and it starts to be a duel for her hand, Let him win. Just...Let him win. Trust me, You'll thank me soon.The Game features 3 Modes. Story Mode (Castle Crashers) and 2 Minigames, Arena and Back-Off Barbarian, Which can be a bit confusing for new players but with a bit of practice, It's easy.Obviously, You can play the modes alone like the lil' basement-dwelling troll you are OR with the friends you have, Mr. Popular.The Animal Orbs are like unlockable passive perks that you can only have one of them. You can buy them or find them.The Weapons you can get can change the stats you have. For Example, The starting weapon Stoveface the Black Knight you can unlock by beating the game with Gray starts with a Gladiator Sword which gives some Attack and Defence but reduces Magic Attacks and has a chance to do a Critical Hit (In my experience of TF2, Is a bad thing for them and a good thing for you.)The Bosses are well done and challening as with the enemies...Except for the Fire Demon, It's evil.Everytime you Level Up, You get 2 skillpoints until 30+ or so where you get only 1. Which is pretty amazing since a 2D-Hack and Slash Beat 'em Up has RPG elements in it too.You can replay it many times you want, There will always be a new playstyle and character waiting for you until you unlock all the elementals.The DLCs (Both Blacksmith and Pink Knight.) Adds 2 more elemental magic and 10 more weapons, So if you're bored, You can always spend a couple of bucks or two.Thats it for the Pros, Let me get to the Cons.It takes too much time to unlock every single thing but none of use here are Completionists anyway, Right?And some bosses require grinding to level up so Speedrunning will be tough.PS : Stoveface-senpai is bae.

Posted: July 22, 2014
												This game mixes crude humor, hack n' slash, and co-op into and great game that has a very fun and compelling storyline. Although the story is short, it makes you beg for more. Leveling in the game is not difficult at all, making the gameplay very enjoyable and not stale. No matter single or co-op it's scaled to be challenging but not impossible to beat. Something that bugs me alot personally is that collecting all the animal orb, weapons and heroes can get tedious at time. Definately recommend getting the game if you're planning on having multiple friends buy the game. One of the best co-op games out there today.

Posted: December 19, 2014
												I /think/ this game is great, but the XBOX 360 on-screen control listings are so.. irritating.. that I can't really stand to play it for very long :) Can we get some button-icons that actually reflect the bound key??Additionally, the "button-mashing" mini-games are /very/ unfriendly to laptop keys :> I'd rather see something Guitar Hero/quick-time-event-ish, with timed button presses, instead of the person who doesn't care about murdering their laptop/controller buttons winning ;)Other than that, everything felt pretty solid, from the little I played :> I just can't keep a running memory of what keys I've got bound to what when "PRESS A!!!" pops up during gameplay, and my "A" button (which isn't colored at all!) makes me walk left, bahaha ;)

												Castle Crashers a game with a fun beat em up style to it.This game combines great humor and fun beat the tar out of enemys system. The game will have you playing for a good time from trying to unlock all the characters,getting all the achivments and getting all the weapons/animal orbs. The bosses range from fun to easy to AWESOME. This game is not perfect however as it gets repetitive and a little easy after a while and most enemys you can juggle in the air with the A and W keys (X and Y buttons for the controler) and in the game's extra mode it becomes too hard as most enemys can 1-3 hit you. Overall this game is fun and gets my raiting of a 4/5.

Also, getting the achievements for winning 20 online all you can quaff matches (mash buttons to eat food really fast: pretty boring minigame) and 40 online arena deathmatches is hard because it's really tough to find a match. Posted: March 18, 2016
												Castle Crashers is exactly what a 2D Beat Em Up should be. It's got good combat gameplay, excellent visuals, a fantastic variety of multiplayer modes, allows up to four players to play the game, great humor, plenty of levels, and a number of playable characters.The game is cartoonish-styled, so expect a lot of over the top humor. Some of it is some mild black comedy, and there is some degree of blood and violence, comparable to TF2, but is slightly more mild.The game has you in a (mostly) medieval setting, with the initial playable characters being four royal knights. There isn't much of a story outside of an evil wizard uniting several other kingdoms to attack yours for some kind of Magic Crystal (that the wizard directly steals) and claim the four princesses for varying reasons (only one is actually known to be held for forced marriage). Honestly though, in a silly beat em up that's as colorful and full of life as this one, it doesn't exactly need a big driving story. It just needs an atmosphere and charm to put on top of it's fun gameplay. And that's exactly what it has. The gameplay is action-packed, wave of enemies after enemies show up constantly as you move forwardi n each level. You learn more attacks and abilities as you level up, and you can also combo enemies through various means, but the main means behind doing that is to jump and knock them into the air, where you can stay airborn for a while by striking your trapped enemies in the air repeatedly. You can use this kind of tactic to trap multiple enemise at once.Of course, not everyone is going to enjoy the genre, so for those that do, the only real downside to this game is that it's gameplay can get repetitive. Sure you learn more moves after a while, and enemies and levels definitely change up, but the core gameplay stays the same, and when the action is so constant, it might get tiring for some pretty quickly. All the more reason to take breaks from the game though, right?Also, there are a HUGE amount of characters to unlock. It can be tedious (some methods are particularly complicated, requiring that you beat story mode all over again with one new character just to unlock another one) so that's one thing about this game I kinda dislike. Not personally, but I can definitely see why other people wouldn't find value in it. If you enjoy the game enough though, you might just see it as replay value instead, especially if you're planning to bring some friends along. And while playing through the main story in singleplayer is definitely enjoyable, this game is most definitely more fun when you're playing with friends.

												Castle Crashers is a game that brings back the fun and excitement of all the flash games that we used to play online. Its hack n' slash gameplay is very well made and gets addictive rapidly. The art style is cartoony and really adds in a sense of humor that just makes the game that much more fun. Along with the vast assortment of weapons and adorable animal companions that can be found throughout the game, there is also an online matchmaking mode that adds a significant amount of replay value. If you want to be generous, consider buying the 4 pack so you and your friends can complete the main story together. This is definitely worth playing.

Posted: January 12, 2015
												8.5/10A very fun hack and slash from Tom Fulp, creator of Newgrounds. One of the best hack and slash games around with a wonderful art style, a great sound track, and tons of unlockables. The replay value is through the roof as you'll constantly be telling yourself "ok, just one more game". There are 2 pieces of DLC for $.99 each that are unnecessary to the game play unless you are a completeist and want everything just for the sake of having it. The money from the DLC does go 100% to charity so there is that but, I wouldn't bother unless playing a pink character or having horns is incredibly important to you.The game is cheap as it is, especially considering the many hours of play time you'll potentially get out of it but, as with anything that's been on Steam for any significant length of time, I would add it to my wishlist and wait for a decent sale. And like I said, don't feel pressured into buying the DLC as it doesn't add anything of great value to the game (i.e., levels, more story etc.). It's mostly cosmetic with a few weapons that won't make the game any more or less easy for you as you won't be able to use them until you hit the appropriate levels anyways.

Posted: August 10, 2015
												Castle Crashers is a competitive co-op beat-em-up by the minds behind Alien Hominid. You and three friends travel throughout the kingdom ruining lives and crashing castles on your stubborn quest to save the princesses. There are tons of landscapes to traverse, weapons and characters to unlock, and princesses to kiss. You can even gain experience and level up your chosen knight. This has to be the best beat-em-up I've played in a long time, even coming close to beating Scott Pilgrim as my favorite. A great time alone, and even better with friends, Castle Crashers isn't getting outta here without a recommendation.

Posted: April 19, 2015
												Absolutely designed to be played with a controller.  Before purchasing, make sure you have some sort of controller support.  Also I will say that this game is best played with friends or online.  Although I have played it a ton without anyone else, so it is possible.Beyond that, it is a great game.  First played this game on the Xbox 360 and remembered how much fun I had so when I saw it again on Steam, I knew I had to buy it.  Every area in the game is repetitive, but they make up for this by adding in tons of different weapons and animal orbs to collect.  This adds some desire to replay the game multiple times in order to either experience everything or simply do a bit of collecting (took me until my second playthrough to find the dang boomerang).  You start out being able to choose from four different characters, but just like the weapons and animal orbs, there are many other characters to unlock as you play through the game.  Some require you to beat the game with certain characters, and some simply require you to do certain things or progress to certain parts of the game.All of this combined adds replayablility to the game and definately makes this purchase worth every penny.

Posted: July 24, 2014
												Before I reveiw this game i'd like to give some backround as how I came across this gem I first heard of this game when a well known youtube channel called "Game Grumps" started playing it on there show steam train and I fell in love with this game and I knew I had to get it so I decided to get this game along with a few extra copies for a few of my friends and this game is an absolute blast Castle Crashers was originally realesed in 2008 later getting a steam port in 2012 Castle crashers is a 2-D beat-em up with some Rpg elements thrown in such as leveling up stats yet what sets this game apart from the standered beat-em up is 3 things the art style the music and its amazing humor the art style is very simplistic and colorful and it fits perfectly with the games over the top humor the music is truly something to behold an interesting thing is that the games music was made by people submitting there music creations on the flash site Newgrounds and lets just say it did not dissapoint the music seems to fit in so well with every situation in the game my personal favorite peice being Simple Sight by "Real Fraction" or the music when you fight the necromancer it really gets you pumped for a fight the games online is nearly flawless yet I wish the game would make it so it would make so the other players that join you would be the same or close to the same level as you  but thats just a minor nitpick i'd say that castle crashers has become one of my biggest gaming guilty pleasures and is well worth a second playthrough the game has great replay value and playing through the entire game from start to finish with one of my best friends is an expeirence I shall not forget I think that Castle crashers is a instant classic and deserves to be as popular as it is I highly recommend it

Posted: March 5, 2015
												Castle Crashers has always been one of the greatest games I've held dear to me for so many years. It's easy to pick up and play, and with quirky characters and unforgettable bosses you can't help but come back for more. Playing with friends makes the experience all the more fun. The music is amazing and easily immersable with the game.  I recommend to those looking for a time-killing game with some humor added to the mix. It gets a 10/10 from me. (:

Posted: June 18, 2015
												Great game! Only problem I have with it is that it is very, very, boring if you don't have a friend to play co-op with you. And I hate it when people say "this online community is dead" yet when I open up a public lobby it becomes full in a matter of seconds, and yes you can button mash through the game, but that doesn't take away from the fun! I mean.. comeon who doesn't like the usual fairy tail; save the princess{s} and defeat the evil wizard plot/scenario. (there isn't a "story" but you can follow along the actions of the characters, for example the princesses are being dragged away, stuff like that) I also have one more complaint: Sometimes in a lobby with my friends, and in game the game will just freeze up and that is a problem for me seeing as my computer has an i7 4th gen processor and a 690 in it.  I'm positive it isn't my internet because it doesn't happen on other games! It always fixes though, it isn't gamebreaking at all. Another thing, some reviews might say you NEED a controller for the game but that isn't true at all! None of my friends, including myself, don't use our XBOX360 controllers in the game. Yes, the game is a completely unchanged port from the XBOX360, but I mean comeon why does it matter if it says "press x or y to attack" etc., you can litterally press ESC and go into the controls, click keyboard and mouse, and change (or leave) the controls to your liking. What is keeping me into the game is the characters, pets, and weapons. You can unlock 31 characters, 79 unlockable weapons, and 27 pets that you can unlock. Each new character has a new design, a new magic, and sometimes a new weapon. Weapons are abundant throughout the game, whether you buy them, dig them up, have pets find them, or kill enemies. They also have buffs and debuffs depending on the weapon; for example it might raise your strength and magic but minus your defense. They also have "special abilities" which can do a multitude of things; shock your enemies, set fire to your enemies, increase critical hits on your enemies, etc. Now onto pets; Pets are REALLY cool, just like weapons they can buff you, or debuff you. They also have special abilities, such as; finding buried treasure, defeating enemies at low health, bringing you food, etc. etc. That's about all I have to say about this AMAZING game. I totally recommend that you buy Castle Crashers! I now leave you with the best sidescrolling beatem up to date! BYEEEEE

Posted: December 20, 2014
												I had never actually heard of Castle Crashers until one night at a friends house where he introduced it to me on his Xbox 360.  Castle Crashers was also one of the first Indie games I had ever played, before I actually knew about Indie games, so I was really confused as to how such an awesome game had not been on my radar.  Not only did Castle Crashers introduce me to the magic that is Indie games, but it also gave me so much entertainment with its funny, and yet at times intense gameplay.  The Beat'Em Up/Action game not only offers excellent gameplay for a single player experience, but Castle Crashers truly shines due to its amazing Local Co-op.  The amount of laughs and entertainment my friends and I received from sitting on the couch together playing Castle Crashers is just to high, and are a few of the reasons why I love this game so much.  With refreshing animations and art style, classic gameplay and a mix of comedy, you end up with a game that is not only fantastic, but quite possibly one of the most entertaining Co-op games I have ever played.  In Castle Crashers, you assume the role of a knight who will be searching the land for the kidnapped princesses.  Starting off, there are a few knights at first to choose from, but as you progress through the game you can unlock many more.  Each character has four stats, attack, defense, magic, and speed, that you will upgrade as you level up throughout the game.  The most characterizing feature of each character, other than their appearance, is their spells.  If you choose to level up the magic stat, every few levels will grant you a new spell to use.  This alone will give a lot of replay value for the simple fact that each of the spells are unique and have different effects in battle. The stats make for a lot of customization when leveling up your character, as you can choose to be a tank, mage, melee damage, or a combination of multiple stats.   Throughout the campaign, you will face several different enemies, that will become tougher as you advance, as well as some very memorable boss battles.  The plot of the story is a simple one, but in Castle Crashers, gameplay and fun is heavily favored to a intriguing story.  Fighting tons of enemies in a classic Side-Scroller Beat'em Up be it alone or with friends, provides a lot of fun, as well as a lot of replay value.  The combination of addictive gameplay and multiple unique characters, make for numerous playthroughs without ever feeling bored.  I truly cannot recommend this game enough, especially due to Local Co-op.  My playtime on Steam does not show even a quarter of my actual playtime, as I spent majority of the time playing on Xbox 360 with several friends as once a week we would get together after going out for dinner and then play Castle Crashers for a few hours.  If you have a few friends who are looking for a great Co-op experience, then look no further.  Pick up a four pack of Castle Crashers and get ready to be heavily entertained for a while as you and your friends play through this absolute gem of a game.

Posted: June 19, 2015
												Great gameplay and really addicting: couldn't put it down when I played with friends. Really funny too. However, lots of farming involved. More than you might expect from a side-scrolling beat-em-up. If you care about achievements, getting every animal orb is nearly impossible, because two are only for sale for 5,500 gold each, which is a ton in this game. Also, getting the achievements for winning 20 online all you can quaff matches (mash buttons to eat food really fast: pretty boring minigame) and 40 online arena deathmatches is hard because it's really tough to find a match. Way better playing with others because if you die other people can revive you: if you die solo, you restart the level, and this game is much harder solo than with friends.tl;dr: 9/10 with friends, 7/10 solo

Posted: December 2, 2014
												After a short burst of playtime, this game just brought me the memories of playing golden axe back in the time.There are things that I don't like but the as a whole, this game is just awesome. Play it with friends. Behead enemies. Run away from terrifying creatures on the back of a deer. Slam your axe on your friend's face and get the kiss from the princess. All in the name of good fun.The game is easy to learn, control and play. It's hilarious and you'll be laughing a good part of the game.There is an issue though. Although the game is easy to control with the keyboard it should be more specific to the people who are playing it for the first time.The game will tell you what you need to do in certain occasions but it will do it with the controller buttons signs.If you don't know what the LT or Y o B are in your keyboard shortcuts then you might end up a bit frustrated and failing in something important... like reviving someone. The game should give you the hint with the key you choose, I don't think it would be that hard.If you have a controller, use it. Posted: January 31, 2015
												Probably one of the best local coops I have played for a while. To be honest I don't know if this game would be so much fun to play alone, but I still would give it a shot if you cannot get anyone to play with you. PvP was pretty (or completely) dead, but I wouldn't buy this game because of PvP anyway. To me, this game was all about PvE. I made a short list below to point out some things why I would recommend to buy this game:- Smooth gameplay. Controls answer well and didn't see any bugs/crashes.- Variety of different characters.- Boss fights which might actually take a moment to realize how their mechanics work, but stil pretty easily beatable.- Funny graphics.- Leveling your character.- Replay value comes with harder difficulty and different characters.

Posted: February 2, 2015
												A great game. Really simple to learn but still challenging. This game was made by the same company that made Battleblock theatre so you are in for a really well made and funny treat. If you own both games you actually get a special char pet and weapon here.Really fun to play in coop, online or lan. I actually play it in lan coop. 1 person using 360 controller and myself on the keyboard (pc gamer lol) (both feel really fluid). No late reaction, button, portability, or any problems really. Its actually just as smooth on the keyboard and mouse as it is on the controller. The whole concept is simple, yet it is deep and character progression is really well reflected on each level. Char variety is also really awesome, powers are different and it allows for a legit online experience.Seriously, this game will be fun playing it casually or hardcore, so its a great game to play with non-gamers GFs and gamer friends alike.9/10

Posted: December 18, 2014
												Let me tell you a story.Playing this game with 4 friends on Xbox. We were semi good people so we were trying to give one friend the "Kiss all the princesses in a multiplayer game" achievement.  I was the Blue Knight, and had a fairly balanced build between Magic and Damage, with a little bit of health and dex thrown in, and I was using the Bi-Polar Bear animal orb.  The friend getting the achievement was the Orange Knight, and he put every point he earned into magic untill he maxed it out.  No hp or damage or anything.  We had another friend, playing the Fire Demon character and using the Rammy Animal Orb.  Incase you didnt know, rammy will randomly knock people down (I dont remember if it does damage or not).The final boss has just been defeated and now we must fight for the last princess. We planned on letting Orange knight win, but rammy had other plans. The second the fight started Rammy knocked down our Orange knight. I hit him once and because of his build it did more damage than expected and pretty much half healthed him.  I was backing off now, to let him win, but Bi Polar Bear went over and executed Orange knight. He was mad, and I got 15 minuets of straight laughter. 10/10

Posted: August 18, 2015
 Full Video Review 


YouTube™ Video: Berty Reviews - Castle Crashers (Feat: Rehthea & Scudponies) 

			Views: 85		

			Berty reviews Castle Crasher. Here's how the scoring system works. Golden 5- You MUST own this game/game franchise 5= I loved it, 4= I liked it, 3= It was OK 2= It was below average but had its...		

 What's Castle Crashers? Castle Crashers is a 2d platform indie Beat'm Up game. After playing so many hours of this game on the Xbox 360, I was very happy to see this game made it to steam so I could enjoy the whole experience all over again. I would recommend playing this game with a controller though. Pros  Amazing Soundtrack Loads of replay value   You never know where each level will take you, one minutes you'll be fighting each other to kiss a princess the next you'll be running away from a giant troll on a deer that has some bowel problems.  Enemies are unique and fun to fight.  21 boss fights  RPG level up system  Animal Orbs & Weapons to collect.  Rammy is life, Rammy is love.  Insane mode if you're feeling brave  Many moments that make you laugh  Can be played and completed in single player if you prefer but I'd recommend bringing friends for a more enjoyable experience  The ending is one of the funniest I've ever seen and completely random.  The most fun coop game I've ever played.  Lot's of characters to unlock  Max level of 99  "All you can quaff" a button mashing mini game where you have to eat your food faster than the other players   An arena game mode, where you compete in a variety of team and free for all game modes, including melee fights, archery fights, treasure hunting and more.  When you eat a sandwhich you become massive and really strong  Lots of different environments to fight in, including a forest, a lava world, the dessert, a snowy mountain, a swamp and many more.  The price! £10 is a steal!   Did I mention you ride a deer that has bowel problems?! I mean, you should buy it just for that.  Cons   None  Final VerdictSo is this game worth it?  I feel like this is a rather unique game, at least from every game I've personally played and  I've never played something like this, a game where one minute you're fighting ninja pirates and the next you're playing a friendly game of volley ball. Each level felt exciting and new, the bosses were fun, the enemies were unique to each area, the game has a way to make you laugh at the silliest of things. The replay value is incredible, the soundtrack is amazing, the memoires you'll make from the game will stick with you, you'll have so much fun with your friends and you can get all of it for just £10! This game is worth every bit of money you'll spend on it and then some. So grab your friends, kill some barbarians and fight each other for a princess! 5/5

Posted: March 12, 2016
												Really fun game that you can get for pretty cheap during sales. I'll try to make this review short and sweet.PROS:-Lots of characters that are somewhat different from one another.-High replay value.-Nice soundtrack.-Awesome gameplay from a pretty rare game style nowadays(beat em' up).-Really great art style that didn't age.-Almost no DLC which means that you get the FULL game without having to buy any extras(there are only two dlc that are characters/weapons and you don't need them at all to enjoy the game 100%).-Lots of fun to play PVP with some friends.-Nice combat system.CON:-Pretty short story.Even though it's best played with some friends, it's still an excellent game to play by yourself. If you're a fan of beat em' ups or you've never experienced that type of game, I suggest you to wait for a sale, grab some friends and a controller and enjoy.Side note: After you beat the game, you can play on a higher difficulty (much like ratchet and clank) which gives the game more replay value.

Posted: April 19
												Castle Crashers is a good game but not without it's flaws. The base game is short and easy to complete, and their isn't alot of replayability. Sure you can repeat the same campaign over and over again if you want to unlock all the characters, but that is repetative and boring. If your going to play this game, you need friends. The Co-op is what really gives this game its stride. Rushing through waves of enemies and fighting over who levels up the fastest is the best way to play. The online co-op does have one major issue though. LAG. If even one of your friends doesn't have the best internet connection, the entire game will stop and reconnect everyone. When you are connected, the frame rate really tanks. However, their is alot of good about this game too. You can play insane mode, were your objective changes from out-leveling your friends to survivng with them. The two mini gamemods are a good way to kill time with your friends as well, but they also suffer the same problems with lag. I have never tested the local co-op but I would imagine this fixes the lag issue. The game has a fun story with a humorous art style, and good animation. The gameplay is fun, with lots of combos for you to perfect, but it can also get repetative. Depending on the difficulty, games can seem boringly easy, or stupidly hard. If you have friends than you should definitly give this game a try.

Posted: June 20, 2014
												I really enjoyed this game, I've put way too many hours into it.Pros:-Lots of replay value from the versatility of how you build your character, and with lots of unlockable characters, you'll be experimenting with all of them. The game really encourages this.-Tons of collectables and unlockables if you're into that thing (like I am)-Online co-op is really fun, and a great way to get friends startedCons:-I'm not a huge fan of the immature humor so it's a con for me, but it's a pro for some people-If you play online with random groups you'll often just do the last boss over and over again, don't do if you don't want spoilers-Hard to find people to do hard mode with online-DLC required to unlock all the characters, which isn't good for people like me who like to %100 games.Overall, get this game on sale and get a few copies to give to friends if you'd like. It's more fun with people you know, but still really fun by yourself.

Posted: February 7, 2015
												Castle Crashers is a fun game. The gameplay is simple, yet entertaining. Combos become available as you progress your character and each new move fits in nicely with the other mechanics. You level up each character separately which is both tedious and a reason to play even more. There's a decent leveling system and some interesting weapon stats. Each character plays through the story mode separately.The story is really nothing of note. It's the classic "Damsel in Distress" plot and none of your characters really differ from each other besides the element their magic takes the shape of. Most of the humor is juvenile at best and, from my experience, tends to annoy rather than entertain. All the cutscenes are unskippable, which means the game forces you to watch animals take a dump every time you load up that level. It's a good time-waster, but it's unlikely that you'll be able to invest any emotion into the characters or events. I sugest getting it to play with friends. 7/10

Posted: March 12, 2016
												Really fun game that you can get for pretty cheap during sales. I'll try to make this review short and sweet.PROS:-Lots of characters that are somewhat different from one another.-High replay value.-Nice soundtrack.-Awesome gameplay from a pretty rare game style nowadays(beat em' up).-Really great art style that didn't age.-Almost no DLC which means that you get the FULL game without having to buy any extras(there are only two dlc that are characters/weapons and you don't need them at all to enjoy the game 100%).-Lots of fun to play PVP with some friends.-Nice combat system.CON:-Pretty short story.Even though it's best played with some friends, it's still an excellent game to play by yourself. If you're a fan of beat em' ups or you've never experienced that type of game, I suggest you to wait for a sale, grab some friends and a controller and enjoy.Side note: After you beat the game, you can play on a higher difficulty (much like ratchet and clank) which gives the game more replay value.

Posted: August 21, 2016
												Castle Crashers is a great game, an instant classic. Pros-Simple-Easy and Fun to Play-Funny and Light Hearted-Suprisingly Good GraphicsCons-Lack of smoothness and balance in some areas. For example, on some levels you get all the way to the end for a boss fight. It takes, say, 10 minutes to get there. You die at the boss fight and you have to restart the whole level. It gets annoying to be stuck on one part over and over. -It can be inconsistent or unclear. For example, to break open a treasure chest or a wall to continue a level, you need to be in an exact position or spot for it to work. Sometimes this means you'll get stuck in an area swinging your sword around blindly because you weren't in the right spot to bust a wall open. Nonethelessthis is a really fun game. The developers of this game are awesome imo. They know how to just make a good old fashioned video game that's fun, has levels, boss fights, a story and a little bit of humor.

Posted: December 26, 2014
Castle Crashers was really fun. Really, really fun. For a simple hack-and-slash game, it's actually very impresive that Castle Crashers did not get stale, repetitive, or boring during the entire time I played it. Maybe it's because of the game's many, many unlockables. Maybe it's because of the gameplay's excellent execution. Maybe it's because of the kooky sense of style that permeates the entire experience.Developed by the Behemoth, Castle Crashers opens with your character (or characters, if you're playing co-op) dancing to the worst tavern music ever concieved, only for the party to be cut off by a lone knight, who tumbles through the door riddled with arrows and proceeds to die immediately. You go out to see what's up, only to discover that your castle is under seige and the four princesses have been captured!Thus begins one wild ride, with increasingly impressive boss fights and set pieces, all with a sly sense of humor. You'll fight your way through the land, searching for each princess, slaying fearsome beasts, and accomplishing great acts of derring-do.One of the most memorable and entertaining sequences has you crashing a wedding to save the Green Princess, only for her to be kidnapped again (by a mechanical cyclops, no less) and taken away. Not if you can help it! Your characters jump out of a window to land on top of the horse-drawn carriage carting the princess off. There, you engage in thrilling combat with several of the cyclops' cronies. But wait! During the battle, a humongous troll with laser vision begins chasing the carriage, gunning for you!I won't tell you how that ends, but rest assured, the entire game is epic and hilarious. There's a large variety of enemies, some easier to fight than others, and your strengths and weaknesses will be determined by how you choose to level up your character. The bosses are all carried out on the grandest of scales, and each one brings a different challenge to the table. The world is expansive and filled with interesting locales. There are tons of weapons hidden throughout the game, and players going back through some of the levels to explore will be well rewarded.Castle Crashers is an excellent entry in the Behemoth's game catalogue, and it delights from start to finish.9 out of 10.

Posted: October 24, 2015
												This game is honestly one of my favorite gaming experiences from the last decade.  I grew up playing 2D side-scrolling beat 'em ups in arcades (yes, those still existed in my day), but it has been quite a long time since I've played anything new in that genre.  Enter Castle Crashers.  This game had a ton of hype after its success on consoles, and luckily it lived up to that hype.  Castle Crashers is a beat 'em up with a couple of twists.  It adds combos to the combat system, which mixes things up and adds variety.  In addition the characters level up and have stats that you can put experience points into, as well as you're able to equip different weapons with different stats.  These RPG-like additions mean that you can play the game in different ways (rely on speed, heavy damage, magic, etc.).  This really adds to the game, and ensures that you have a unique experience.  While the story is a bit weak, the overall length of the game and the variation in game levels is phenomenal.  The game even offers a new game+ mode after you beat it.  This game screams multiplayer, but I played it predominantly as a single player due to a lack of friends interested in playing.  While I ran into no problems playing the regular mode as a single player, about halfway through the new game+ mode I found it too difficult to progress.  I suppose I could have grinded my character's level at that point, but instead I chose to start a brand new character and play the game in a different manner this time (I would rely on magic).  Overall this game is a joy, and builds upon and improves on the formula set out by such classics as Double Dragon and Final Fight.  This game is so good that it makes me wonder why it took so long for someone to rejuvenate the beat 'em up genre.  This game is fantastic and I would rate it a 9.5/10.

Posted: March 18, 2016
												Castle Crashers is exactly what a 2D Beat Em Up should be. It's got good combat gameplay, excellent visuals, a fantastic variety of multiplayer modes, allows up to four players to play the game, great humor, plenty of levels, and a number of playable characters.The game is cartoonish-styled, so expect a lot of over the top humor. Some of it is some mild black comedy, and there is some degree of blood and violence, comparable to TF2, but is slightly more mild.The game has you in a (mostly) medieval setting, with the initial playable characters being four royal knights. There isn't much of a story outside of an evil wizard uniting several other kingdoms to attack yours for some kind of Magic Crystal (that the wizard directly steals) and claim the four princesses for varying reasons (only one is actually known to be held for forced marriage). Honestly though, in a silly beat em up that's as colorful and full of life as this one, it doesn't exactly need a big driving story. It just needs an atmosphere and charm to put on top of it's fun gameplay. And that's exactly what it has. The gameplay is action-packed, wave of enemies after enemies show up constantly as you move forwardi n each level. You learn more attacks and abilities as you level up, and you can also combo enemies through various means, but the main means behind doing that is to jump and knock them into the air, where you can stay airborn for a while by striking your trapped enemies in the air repeatedly. You can use this kind of tactic to trap multiple enemise at once.Of course, not everyone is going to enjoy the genre, so for those that do, the only real downside to this game is that it's gameplay can get repetitive. Sure you learn more moves after a while, and enemies and levels definitely change up, but the core gameplay stays the same, and when the action is so constant, it might get tiring for some pretty quickly. All the more reason to take breaks from the game though, right?Also, there are a HUGE amount of characters to unlock. It can be tedious (some methods are particularly complicated, requiring that you beat story mode all over again with one new character just to unlock another one) so that's one thing about this game I kinda dislike. Not personally, but I can definitely see why other people wouldn't find value in it. If you enjoy the game enough though, you might just see it as replay value instead, especially if you're planning to bring some friends along. And while playing through the main story in singleplayer is definitely enjoyable, this game is most definitely more fun when you're playing with friends.

												This game is awesome! It has a great sense of humor, though things are still epic and serious. There are many characters to unlock which is always a good thing, and the pets are adorable (well, some of them, anyway o.o). The only cons is that it can, in fact, get boring after a while, but the fun can last forever if you're playing with a good friend. Talking about friends, the Online Multiplayer in this is pretty bad, not gonna lie. But I'll admit that that's because of some people's internet (not everyone's internet can be as fast as mine~).Overall, this game has many pros and very little cons, so I really recommend it. And to make it better, its 4 players! To me, that's perfect (not too less, not too many; though I do think they could of squeezed a fifth player in there.).

Posted: June 19, 2015
												Great gameplay and really addicting: couldn't put it down when I played with friends. Really funny too. However, lots of farming involved. More than you might expect from a side-scrolling beat-em-up. If you care about achievements, getting every animal orb is nearly impossible, because two are only for sale for 5,500 gold each, which is a ton in this game. Also, getting the achievements for winning 20 online all you can quaff matches (mash buttons to eat food really fast: pretty boring minigame) and 40 online arena deathmatches is hard because it's really tough to find a match. Way better playing with others because if you die other people can revive you: if you die solo, you restart the level, and this game is much harder solo than with friends.tl;dr: 9/10 with friends, 7/10 solo

Posted: August 18, 2015
 Full Video Review 


YouTube™ Video: Berty Reviews - Castle Crashers (Feat: Rehthea & Scudponies) 

			Views: 85		

			Berty reviews Castle Crasher. Here's how the scoring system works. Golden 5- You MUST own this game/game franchise 5= I loved it, 4= I liked it, 3= It was OK 2= It was below average but had its...		

 What's Castle Crashers? Castle Crashers is a 2d platform indie Beat'm Up game. After playing so many hours of this game on the Xbox 360, I was very happy to see this game made it to steam so I could enjoy the whole experience all over again. I would recommend playing this game with a controller though. Pros  Amazing Soundtrack Loads of replay value   You never know where each level will take you, one minutes you'll be fighting each other to kiss a princess the next you'll be running away from a giant troll on a deer that has some bowel problems.  Enemies are unique and fun to fight.  21 boss fights  RPG level up system  Animal Orbs & Weapons to collect.  Rammy is life, Rammy is love.  Insane mode if you're feeling brave  Many moments that make you laugh  Can be played and completed in single player if you prefer but I'd recommend bringing friends for a more enjoyable experience  The ending is one of the funniest I've ever seen and completely random.  The most fun coop game I've ever played.  Lot's of characters to unlock  Max level of 99  "All you can quaff" a button mashing mini game where you have to eat your food faster than the other players   An arena game mode, where you compete in a variety of team and free for all game modes, including melee fights, archery fights, treasure hunting and more.  When you eat a sandwhich you become massive and really strong  Lots of different environments to fight in, including a forest, a lava world, the dessert, a snowy mountain, a swamp and many more.  The price! £10 is a steal!   Did I mention you ride a deer that has bowel problems?! I mean, you should buy it just for that.  Cons   None  Final VerdictSo is this game worth it?  I feel like this is a rather unique game, at least from every game I've personally played and  I've never played something like this, a game where one minute you're fighting ninja pirates and the next you're playing a friendly game of volley ball. Each level felt exciting and new, the bosses were fun, the enemies were unique to each area, the game has a way to make you laugh at the silliest of things. The replay value is incredible, the soundtrack is amazing, the memoires you'll make from the game will stick with you, you'll have so much fun with your friends and you can get all of it for just £10! This game is worth every bit of money you'll spend on it and then some. So grab your friends, kill some barbarians and fight each other for a princess! 5/5

Posted: July 24, 2014
												Before I reveiw this game i'd like to give some backround as how I came across this gem I first heard of this game when a well known youtube channel called "Game Grumps" started playing it on there show steam train and I fell in love with this game and I knew I had to get it so I decided to get this game along with a few extra copies for a few of my friends and this game is an absolute blast Castle Crashers was originally realesed in 2008 later getting a steam port in 2012 Castle crashers is a 2-D beat-em up with some Rpg elements thrown in such as leveling up stats yet what sets this game apart from the standered beat-em up is 3 things the art style the music and its amazing humor the art style is very simplistic and colorful and it fits perfectly with the games over the top humor the music is truly something to behold an interesting thing is that the games music was made by people submitting there music creations on the flash site Newgrounds and lets just say it did not dissapoint the music seems to fit in so well with every situation in the game my personal favorite peice being Simple Sight by "Real Fraction" or the music when you fight the necromancer it really gets you pumped for a fight the games online is nearly flawless yet I wish the game would make it so it would make so the other players that join you would be the same or close to the same level as you  but thats just a minor nitpick i'd say that castle crashers has become one of my biggest gaming guilty pleasures and is well worth a second playthrough the game has great replay value and playing through the entire game from start to finish with one of my best friends is an expeirence I shall not forget I think that Castle crashers is a instant classic and deserves to be as popular as it is I highly recommend it

Posted: December 26, 2014
Castle Crashers was really fun. Really, really fun. For a simple hack-and-slash game, it's actually very impresive that Castle Crashers did not get stale, repetitive, or boring during the entire time I played it. Maybe it's because of the game's many, many unlockables. Maybe it's because of the gameplay's excellent execution. Maybe it's because of the kooky sense of style that permeates the entire experience.Developed by the Behemoth, Castle Crashers opens with your character (or characters, if you're playing co-op) dancing to the worst tavern music ever concieved, only for the party to be cut off by a lone knight, who tumbles through the door riddled with arrows and proceeds to die immediately. You go out to see what's up, only to discover that your castle is under seige and the four princesses have been captured!Thus begins one wild ride, with increasingly impressive boss fights and set pieces, all with a sly sense of humor. You'll fight your way through the land, searching for each princess, slaying fearsome beasts, and accomplishing great acts of derring-do.One of the most memorable and entertaining sequences has you crashing a wedding to save the Green Princess, only for her to be kidnapped again (by a mechanical cyclops, no less) and taken away. Not if you can help it! Your characters jump out of a window to land on top of the horse-drawn carriage carting the princess off. There, you engage in thrilling combat with several of the cyclops' cronies. But wait! During the battle, a humongous troll with laser vision begins chasing the carriage, gunning for you!I won't tell you how that ends, but rest assured, the entire game is epic and hilarious. There's a large variety of enemies, some easier to fight than others, and your strengths and weaknesses will be determined by how you choose to level up your character. The bosses are all carried out on the grandest of scales, and each one brings a different challenge to the table. The world is expansive and filled with interesting locales. There are tons of weapons hidden throughout the game, and players going back through some of the levels to explore will be well rewarded.Castle Crashers is an excellent entry in the Behemoth's game catalogue, and it delights from start to finish.9 out of 10.

Posted: June 22, 2015
												Pros Castle Crashers is a 4 player, local beat em up brawler and is the game most people think of when they play brawlers. i have played Castle Crashers on both PC and Xbox. I rate the game very highly and it is the best of its genre of 4 player brawlers. this game is a great game to play by yourself but it is much more fun with friends and you can meet good people on servers of this game. the game has 2 difficulty modes normal and insane mode, and insane mode is very challenging. If you think hard isn't hard enough you can play the game without spending any level up points making it more challenging and this game is very fun when you set your own goals. the game is full of content with tons of weapons, characters, pets, and other unlock-ables to make the game worth replaying multiple times. the graphics on this game are great, it looks like a beautiful flash game and this version has great options for its sound, display, controls, rebind-able keys, and it has excellent controller support. if you on other games owned by the same company you unlock a playable character in that game example if you own battle block theater you can unlock hatty hattington. Cons The game is kinda short but its not a big problem because its replayable but still, you will get sick of playing the same levels so many times new levels would have fixed this problem  Leveling up to 99 takes too long, previously there were tricks to level up like the boomerang glitch, the 256 glitch, and other tricks but they have been patched and that HUGELY take away from the game, when i had played castle crashers on the xbox 360 the boomerang glitch was partly patched where the exp rewarding glitch would only work in the industrial castle and that made it easier to level up you could really level up fast if you did the trick with insane mode on but sadly that has been patched. in my opinion patching games are really good, game breaking bugs need to be fixed obviously, i had no problem with the 256 glitch being removed, making the boomerang glitch work on only one boss was alright, but i think that taking out makes leveling up stupidly long without out of game cheats. A few of characters use the same ability's example the grey knight and the cone head knight have the exact same magic ability's, and you need to beat the glitch specific characters to unlock other ones. ConclusionOverall its worth it and really enjoyable to play but the level up system needs at least a few more easy ways to level up it takes quite a long time to level up making the game very hard to fully complete. i would recommend a console version over the PC version because the level up system is simply better. i also recommend all the DLC it is worthwhile to pay for the new content, the pink knight DLC is worthwhile and the purple knight DLC is not as interesting as the pink knight DLC mainly because of one weapon (put simply because the broccoli sword is the best starting weapon), but still worth it. Castle Crashers is a must have in my opinion, worth every cent and is the definitive game of its genre.

Posted: June 26, 2013
												Although I found it a bit weird that it took 4 years after the initial release on the Xbox 360, for it to come out on PC, it still doesn't really matter, because I finally have it, and I have finally enjoyed it. Castle Crashers for PC is just like the Xbox 360 and PS3 version. Fun, medieval sword fighting against evil knights, monsters, and strange creatures. The game is very nicely done, with good graphics, and fun, addicting levels and gameplay. Castle Crashers is best enjoyed through online multiplayer with friends or strangers. That said, the game lets you enable voice chat for a more fun multiplayer experience. I seriously think it's a powerful, and engaging fighting experience. Even if it is very cartoony. It's still a good game

Posted: February 15, 2016
												There's no doubt this game deserves a positive review.Why?Well, I'll just put all of my reasons down into this one review.--------------------------------------------------------------Number 1) Creative idea.There's no doubt that when you look at Castle Crashers, you see no resemblence of any game out there. That, my friend, is the beauty of Behemoth. Their games are all origanal ideas, and Castle Crashers is no exception. This is only one reason I recommend Castle Crashers, you never know what might happen next.Number 2) There's always something to play forWhat do I mean by this? What I mean is that whenever you play Castle Crashers, you always have SOMETHING to do on it.For example, you might be trying to unlock a new character out of about 31 of them. You may be trying to own everybody in an arena match, or playing the mini games included in Castle Crashers. You may be grinding for a larger level and more gold, or trying to beat Insane Mode for the beautiful golden skull.Number 3) StratagyNow, first off it's important to note that Castle Crashers is a button mashing game. It seems like there's no stratagy involved, when truely, there is. There's times when you have to cast a magical spell, or times when you need to sling an arrow. Times when you have to bash rival's skulls with weapons, times when you need to dodge all of their attacks.This is a small reason I recommend this game, but I think it's sort of worth mentioning in this review.Number 4) Simple controllsNow, when I say this, I also want to note that Castle Crashers is SO much easier with a plug-in controller. That being said, this number is all about the simple controlls with a CONTROLLER.Here are the only controlls you need to memorize: Light attack button, hard attack button, use item button, scroll item buttons, and toggle magic button. Oh yeah, and jump.It seems like alot, but it is SO easy to memorize.  Number 5) Large amount of playable charactersWhen I say this, I mean LARGE. Well, about 31, including 2 cheap DLCS and an unlockable character you can only get if you get Battle Block Theater.The others are unlocked by certain paths, beating arenas or levels, and beating bosses in Insane Mode. There's all different character paths you can do, such as the Red Knight being Red knight > Skeleton > Bear, each one unlocked by beating the game with another. Each character has their own looks, names, and unique magic abilities that makes the player really want to unlock each one.Number 6) (Final) Very creative rivals, bosses, and playable characters.When I say this, I mean very creative. Some of them may have some inspiriation, but for the most part they are all orgianal ideas. They all have their different attacks, and the bosses are each hard and annoying in their own ways. These make each different boss and characters unique as can be, a small reason I recommend this game, but still a reason.I hope you enjoyed this long review, and I hope that I made up your mind whether or not to buy this game if you haven't already. It is an amazing game, well worth the 10-15$ it was priced with.~TheRetrieverArmy

Posted: June 14, 2016
												It is an old game but since i primarily game on a laptop I'm always looking for good games that can run on my system.Castle Crashers looks really good, play really well. The controls are easy to use both on the keyboard and xbox controller (although i keep accidently using my items from the tiny inventory) so this is great to play with friends with little or no gaming experience. Theres tons of weapons and all the upgradable character abilities are equally important which makes it a challenge to prioritize your skill points. The game is a good balance of difficulty, not too hard or too easy and theres a wide variety of enemies and bosses in an art style i really dig. After completing the game the first time round, Castle Crashers still has more to give. The addition of insane mode and secrets all over the map like weapons to dig up and animal orbs in the store makes sure you never get tired of this game. Very worth my money. Get it if you're bored, get it if you have friends coming over, get it if you haven't.

Posted: June 18, 2015
												Great game! Only problem I have with it is that it is very, very, boring if you don't have a friend to play co-op with you. And I hate it when people say "this online community is dead" yet when I open up a public lobby it becomes full in a matter of seconds, and yes you can button mash through the game, but that doesn't take away from the fun! I mean.. comeon who doesn't like the usual fairy tail; save the princess{s} and defeat the evil wizard plot/scenario. (there isn't a "story" but you can follow along the actions of the characters, for example the princesses are being dragged away, stuff like that) I also have one more complaint: Sometimes in a lobby with my friends, and in game the game will just freeze up and that is a problem for me seeing as my computer has an i7 4th gen processor and a 690 in it.  I'm positive it isn't my internet because it doesn't happen on other games! It always fixes though, it isn't gamebreaking at all. Another thing, some reviews might say you NEED a controller for the game but that isn't true at all! None of my friends, including myself, don't use our XBOX360 controllers in the game. Yes, the game is a completely unchanged port from the XBOX360, but I mean comeon why does it matter if it says "press x or y to attack" etc., you can litterally press ESC and go into the controls, click keyboard and mouse, and change (or leave) the controls to your liking. What is keeping me into the game is the characters, pets, and weapons. You can unlock 31 characters, 79 unlockable weapons, and 27 pets that you can unlock. Each new character has a new design, a new magic, and sometimes a new weapon. Weapons are abundant throughout the game, whether you buy them, dig them up, have pets find them, or kill enemies. They also have buffs and debuffs depending on the weapon; for example it might raise your strength and magic but minus your defense. They also have "special abilities" which can do a multitude of things; shock your enemies, set fire to your enemies, increase critical hits on your enemies, etc. Now onto pets; Pets are REALLY cool, just like weapons they can buff you, or debuff you. They also have special abilities, such as; finding buried treasure, defeating enemies at low health, bringing you food, etc. etc. That's about all I have to say about this AMAZING game. I totally recommend that you buy Castle Crashers! I now leave you with the best sidescrolling beatem up to date! BYEEEEE

Posted: December 18, 2014
												Let me tell you a story.Playing this game with 4 friends on Xbox. We were semi good people so we were trying to give one friend the "Kiss all the princesses in a multiplayer game" achievement.  I was the Blue Knight, and had a fairly balanced build between Magic and Damage, with a little bit of health and dex thrown in, and I was using the Bi-Polar Bear animal orb.  The friend getting the achievement was the Orange Knight, and he put every point he earned into magic untill he maxed it out.  No hp or damage or anything.  We had another friend, playing the Fire Demon character and using the Rammy Animal Orb.  Incase you didnt know, rammy will randomly knock people down (I dont remember if it does damage or not).The final boss has just been defeated and now we must fight for the last princess. We planned on letting Orange knight win, but rammy had other plans. The second the fight started Rammy knocked down our Orange knight. I hit him once and because of his build it did more damage than expected and pretty much half healthed him.  I was backing off now, to let him win, but Bi Polar Bear went over and executed Orange knight. He was mad, and I got 15 minuets of straight laughter. 10/10

Posted: December 24, 2013
												Okay, Pros: Co-op, arcade style, fun with friends, fairly good animation, several different types of enemies, think outside the box art style, epic music, uniqe and old school style boss fights, and beleive it or not REALLY good story. Two more additional things, Behemoth, and I think Battle Block Theater should be on steam.Cons: CONTROLLER OR DIE, playing without friends is boring, difficult playing alone.Overall: Buy the game when its full price. If you have a friend (or a few) that want to play too, buy a copy for each of them too. Endless hilarity insues amongst your friends, the game itself, and soon you will be cackling over the micrphone about the endless laughs and enjoyment this game will bring to your life. End note: I wasn't kidding about "CONTROLLER OR DIE" if you want to NOT be confused by the game's UI, get a WIRED Xbox 360 controller. Trust me, it'll boost your gameplay experience by about hmmmm: 25%-60-ish%.

Posted: June 28, 2015
												Castle Crashers is definitely an amazing game, and already an all-time favorite. The beauty with Castle Crashers is that while it is very simple when compared to other games, it is still awesome. The story is simple, bad dudes are taking princesses, rescue them. You just hack and slash everything in your way, while unlocking cool weapons, pets, and characters. The game also has some RPG elements to add some depth to it. Playing by yourself is fun, but when you play with others it is a great adventure. I highly recommend getting this game. I bought it for $4 Canadian, but I think that it is still worth $16.99 ($15 US I think). The game is something that you will never forget.

Posted: July 13, 2015
												I love this game, if you haven't played it, it's best to try and play it with others who also haven't tried it yet. Going through it your first time as a group is extremely fun. It's fairly simple and short, but highly replayable, and the little cinematics remain enjoyable, and you may notice something you didn't before while doing another playthrough. It is a pretty button mashy beat-em-up, so if you want gameplay with a lot of variety, this may not be the best choice, Otherwise, hitting x a bunch of times and juggling enemies in the air from one side of the screen to the other remains fun. My only issue is the experience system. You get experience for hitting enemies (except when they've died and you're not letting their corpses rest peacefully), regardless of damage. If you are stronger than the other players, you will level up slower. This sort of inhibits magic users from leveling decently, since you deal high damage in few hits.If you look at the negative reviews, most of them are people complaining that the game is unplayable on keyboard. I first played the game on Xbox, loved it, eventually got it on PC and still loved it. Recently the A button on my controller got jammed after hours of a little game called Ys Origin...so now I use the keyboard. Guess what? I'm completely fine, the game is still entirely playable, fun, and not really any harder. The people complaining probably just suck...ignore them. The instructions do only show Xbox controls, making you have to test to figure out the controls, but you can map the keys you want to use anyway.
