Posted: March 31, 2016
												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Posted: March 2, 2016
												Castle Crashers is a fun, qwerky rpg with a unique artstyle. The gameplay will require you to work with your team and at times, allow you to become competitive. The game allows you to play with friends easily, and allows you to level up each individual character you unlock separately. A fun game, but can lag. It's as unique as it is challenging.

Posted: January 4, 2015
												Castle Crashers is a good ol' fashion beat 'em up with small twerks like magic and other things.A good idea is to not play alone, even another person with you will make the game more fun and easier. Another nice feature is having pets, pets give you a boost in something whether it be agility and damage, defense, increased xp gain, etc. Everytime you level up you gain 2-1 skill points but sadly its not a skill tree function. Instead you upgrade 4 stats, Strength, Magic, Defense, and Agility.I'd like to also point out the interesting art style that makes all the colors easier to see and more vibrant even though it is such a simple one.I have gotten into a bit of the game myself but I haven't beaten it yet but I shall reveal a small bit of the story.The story follows you/the knight you chose, and while you are rocking out in a castle a large scale invasion has happened by an orcish like creature and the 4 princess are captured. It's up to you and 1-3 other friends to rescue the princesses. Pets, level ups, new weapons, and gold will help you along your way.If you do decied to buy this game (It's 14.99 on steam store) I hope this review helped your choice!I rate this game 9.5/10

Posted: August 21, 2016
												Castle Crashers is a great game, an instant classic. Pros-Simple-Easy and Fun to Play-Funny and Light Hearted-Suprisingly Good GraphicsCons-Lack of smoothness and balance in some areas. For example, on some levels you get all the way to the end for a boss fight. It takes, say, 10 minutes to get there. You die at the boss fight and you have to restart the whole level. It gets annoying to be stuck on one part over and over. -It can be inconsistent or unclear. For example, to break open a treasure chest or a wall to continue a level, you need to be in an exact position or spot for it to work. Sometimes this means you'll get stuck in an area swinging your sword around blindly because you weren't in the right spot to bust a wall open. Nonethelessthis is a really fun game. The developers of this game are awesome imo. They know how to just make a good old fashioned video game that's fun, has levels, boss fights, a story and a little bit of humor.

												There's no doubt this game deserves a positive review.Why?Well, I'll just put all of my reasons down into this one review.--------------------------------------------------------------Number 1) Creative idea.There's no doubt that when you look at Castle Crashers, you see no resemblence of any game out there. That, my friend, is the beauty of Behemoth. Their games are all origanal ideas, and Castle Crashers is no exception. This is only one reason I recommend Castle Crashers, you never know what might happen next.Number 2) There's always something to play forWhat do I mean by this? What I mean is that whenever you play Castle Crashers, you always have SOMETHING to do on it.For example, you might be trying to unlock a new character out of about 31 of them. You may be trying to own everybody in an arena match, or playing the mini games included in Castle Crashers. You may be grinding for a larger level and more gold, or trying to beat Insane Mode for the beautiful golden skull.Number 3) StratagyNow, first off it's important to note that Castle Crashers is a button mashing game. It seems like there's no stratagy involved, when truely, there is. There's times when you have to cast a magical spell, or times when you need to sling an arrow. Times when you have to bash rival's skulls with weapons, times when you need to dodge all of their attacks.This is a small reason I recommend this game, but I think it's sort of worth mentioning in this review.Number 4) Simple controllsNow, when I say this, I also want to note that Castle Crashers is SO much easier with a plug-in controller. That being said, this number is all about the simple controlls with a CONTROLLER.Here are the only controlls you need to memorize: Light attack button, hard attack button, use item button, scroll item buttons, and toggle magic button. Oh yeah, and jump.It seems like alot, but it is SO easy to memorize.  Number 5) Large amount of playable charactersWhen I say this, I mean LARGE. Well, about 31, including 2 cheap DLCS and an unlockable character you can only get if you get Battle Block Theater.The others are unlocked by certain paths, beating arenas or levels, and beating bosses in Insane Mode. There's all different character paths you can do, such as the Red Knight being Red knight > Skeleton > Bear, each one unlocked by beating the game with another. Each character has their own looks, names, and unique magic abilities that makes the player really want to unlock each one.Number 6) (Final) Very creative rivals, bosses, and playable characters.When I say this, I mean very creative. Some of them may have some inspiriation, but for the most part they are all orgianal ideas. They all have their different attacks, and the bosses are each hard and annoying in their own ways. These make each different boss and characters unique as can be, a small reason I recommend this game, but still a reason.I hope you enjoyed this long review, and I hope that I made up your mind whether or not to buy this game if you haven't already. It is an amazing game, well worth the 10-15$ it was priced with.~TheRetrieverArmy

												It is an old game but since i primarily game on a laptop I'm always looking for good games that can run on my system.Castle Crashers looks really good, play really well. The controls are easy to use both on the keyboard and xbox controller (although i keep accidently using my items from the tiny inventory) so this is great to play with friends with little or no gaming experience. Theres tons of weapons and all the upgradable character abilities are equally important which makes it a challenge to prioritize your skill points. The game is a good balance of difficulty, not too hard or too easy and theres a wide variety of enemies and bosses in an art style i really dig. After completing the game the first time round, Castle Crashers still has more to give. The addition of insane mode and secrets all over the map like weapons to dig up and animal orbs in the store makes sure you never get tired of this game. Very worth my money. Get it if you're bored, get it if you have friends coming over, get it if you haven't.

Posted: August 18, 2015
 Full Video Review 


YouTube™ Video: Berty Reviews - Castle Crashers (Feat: Rehthea & Scudponies) 

			Views: 85		

			Berty reviews Castle Crasher. Here's how the scoring system works. Golden 5- You MUST own this game/game franchise 5= I loved it, 4= I liked it, 3= It was OK 2= It was below average but had its...		

 What's Castle Crashers? Castle Crashers is a 2d platform indie Beat'm Up game. After playing so many hours of this game on the Xbox 360, I was very happy to see this game made it to steam so I could enjoy the whole experience all over again. I would recommend playing this game with a controller though. Pros  Amazing Soundtrack Loads of replay value   You never know where each level will take you, one minutes you'll be fighting each other to kiss a princess the next you'll be running away from a giant troll on a deer that has some bowel problems.  Enemies are unique and fun to fight.  21 boss fights  RPG level up system  Animal Orbs & Weapons to collect.  Rammy is life, Rammy is love.  Insane mode if you're feeling brave  Many moments that make you laugh  Can be played and completed in single player if you prefer but I'd recommend bringing friends for a more enjoyable experience  The ending is one of the funniest I've ever seen and completely random.  The most fun coop game I've ever played.  Lot's of characters to unlock  Max level of 99  "All you can quaff" a button mashing mini game where you have to eat your food faster than the other players   An arena game mode, where you compete in a variety of team and free for all game modes, including melee fights, archery fights, treasure hunting and more.  When you eat a sandwhich you become massive and really strong  Lots of different environments to fight in, including a forest, a lava world, the dessert, a snowy mountain, a swamp and many more.  The price! £10 is a steal!   Did I mention you ride a deer that has bowel problems?! I mean, you should buy it just for that.  Cons   None  Final VerdictSo is this game worth it?  I feel like this is a rather unique game, at least from every game I've personally played and  I've never played something like this, a game where one minute you're fighting ninja pirates and the next you're playing a friendly game of volley ball. Each level felt exciting and new, the bosses were fun, the enemies were unique to each area, the game has a way to make you laugh at the silliest of things. The replay value is incredible, the soundtrack is amazing, the memoires you'll make from the game will stick with you, you'll have so much fun with your friends and you can get all of it for just £10! This game is worth every bit of money you'll spend on it and then some. So grab your friends, kill some barbarians and fight each other for a princess! 5/5

Posted: July 11, 2016
												Possibly the best multiplayer game I've ever played.The gameplay is incredibly fun and fast-paced, the combos are satisfying, there are multiple different character builds you can make using the level-up system, and there are  tons  of unlockables, such as new characters with different move sets, new weapons with different stats and special effects, and animal orbs (essentially pets) granting you lots of different bonuses, from increasing your character's strength, through ramming down enemies, to pecking away at knocked down enemies.The remastered edition (the edition available on steam) re-balanced lots of weapon and animal orb stats, and added a new mode called "Back Off Barbarian", in which you escape from constantly spawning enemies and get a rating based on the time you managed to survive.Although the game is intended to be played in co-op, it's perfectly playable and enjoyable in singleplayer.The game's controls work very well with a gamepad, but with some rebinding, can also be quite good on a keyboard.The only larger flaw the game has, in my opinion, is the lack of randomly generated levels and enemies, which would add a lot to the replay value. However, the game is still very replayable thanks to tons of hidden content, such as weapons or animal orbs, making you discover something new every run.The game's soundtrack is fantastic as well, with each area having a very fitting and enjoyable track.The game's art style might seem basic to some, but actually works very well with the game's gameplay and feel.Overall, the steam edition of Castle Crashers is a solid 8.5/10 for me. Would recommend to nearly everyone, even if multiplayer isn't necessarily your thing.tl;dr: The game is very, very good. Buy it. Worth it even at full price.

Posted: September 24, 2013
												This game sponsored me my friend for which I'm thankful.What can I say about Castle Crashers? I wish that this game wasn't so short (like every good game seems to be too short) but because of cooperative it give us a big opportunity to back here and play again and again in different squads.The plot is simple - something has been stolen and we have to get it back. Game is not difficult... Ok, sometimes you have to play again because of dead but this game is more to chill out than to "Arghh I dead 20th time! It makes me so angry". What I like in Castle Crashers is that it's simply funny. On every step there are things that make you smile or even laugh (especially when You are playing with somebody). Cartoon graphics and animations looks really good. Soundtracks are also very well, great suited to each level. It's good game to relax and check out if you can still play games in which the mouse is not necessary.

Posted: December 10, 2013
												The cartoony 2 1/2d revives that old nostalia that I sincerely hope you have for games like LOZ and Street Fighter. The art style also allows people with lower performance computers (Like myself for my first 15ish hours) to run it seemlessly. Throughout the game you'll keep finding new weapons that you can swap at will to gear towards the playstyle you want, but their stats and discovery locations are carefully built so that you'll have a hard time feeling overpowered (Even with the jump/light attack combo that allows to fly around the stage invincible beating the stuffing out of an enemy or two)

Posted: June 1, 2013
												Castle Crashers est un beat'em all jouable à quatre en multijoueur sur Xbox 360, PS3 et récemment sur Steam.Sortez votre épée et frayez-vous un chemin vers la victoire dans ce jeu d'arcade aventure en 2D primé et signé The Behemoth !Outre ses personnages dessinés à la main, Castle Crashers propose des graphismes haute résolution époustouflants.Verdict :Les + :- Univers- Explorez le vaste monde pour sauvez les 4 princesses- Un level design excellent !- Déverrouillez plus de 25 personnages et plus de 40 armes !- Un système de combo et de magie intuitif : débloquez de nouvelles attaques quand votre personnage progresse.- Passez au niveau supérieur et modifiez la Force, la Magie, la Défense et l'Agilité de votre héros.- De gentilles bestioles améliorent différentes aptitudes afin de vous aider tout au long de ce parcours.- Plusieurs mode multijoueurs- Mode Arène : affrontez d'autres joueurs en mode combat libre ou en matches par équipes !- Mode Folie : testez vos capacités en relevant ce défi incroyable !- Booster Pack Necromantic (inclut le Necromancer est les personnages "Cult Minion")- Pack King Booster (inclut The King et Open-Faced Gray Knight)- Mini jeu "All You Can Quaff" Inclut également le personnage "Alien Hominid"Les - :-20/20Un level design excellent, une bande son et une ambiance génial, c'est envoutant. (Quelle surprise !)Un coté oldschool avec des améliorations et une sensation de montée en puissance est réelle, donc c'est agréable .Un jeu sympa, seul ou a plusieurs.On reviens à une ère bien connue des salles d'arcade .

Posted: December 20, 2014
												This game is the definition of "F**k yes! Let's play (insert game title here)."Castle Crashers offers a widespread of dark comedy, poop jokes, and just flat out fun. Like other reviews said, this game is definitely perfect for having 3 buddies over, pizzas and soda. Last night I gave out two CCs to two other friends, we played for three hours and we never realized until one of us said "Holy s**t it's 2:00 am."Castle Crashers has a variety of characters, weapons, animal orbs, and just s**t jokes.My favorite character is essentially the Peasant, but he's not unlocked on here. Many people say "Let's look at reviews and see how great this game is." You can see after you visit the store page, in somewhat top right corner, it will show the overall of unrecommended and recommended reviews. As you can see, it says "Overwhelmingly Positive."This means that people ALL AROUND THE WORLD have reviewed this game on this application we call Steam.It means that (those who have discovered this game and have played and made reviews about this) they love this game, and they should showcase it to the world and recommend it to those who in the future visit the store page and want to read other players' reviews.All in all, this game is very solid, has few bugs and glitches, a very selective variety of characters, animal orbs, weaponry and humour.I'd give it a solid 8/10This game never gets old, unless you're stuck on a level, then you ragequit.

 ✓ My Rating ✓ :   9/11    8.5/10	  PROS: ✓ Fine Selection of Starter Characters✓ FinER  Selection of Unlockable Characters (which you will unlock as the game progresses & also work for)✓ XP Leveling System which will take a high level to fulfill all attributes (if your into completing the game 100%)✓ High Replay Value! (To Unlock more characters/ Playing with  Filthy Casuals	 n00by friends)✓ Story Mode Co-op (4 players max) / Minigame Co-op (4 players max)✓ Multiple Game Modes (The reason I'm nominating this game during 11/23/2016 for "Best Game with in a Game" Award)        Multiple Game Modes Include:  Back - off Barbarian:  A minigame styled as a board game that contains enemies to avoid at a constantly faster rate with more enemies to avoid spawning (Best done with friends so you can "volunteer" them to sacrifice themselves for your life)  (Also Contains a butt-clenching, soul torturing, undeniably difficult   ♥♥♥♥ING ACHIEVEMENT THAT I CAN NAY GET)    Arena Mode: A game mode that sounds exactly how it's named: Ya fight to the death with random people or your friends online.  Story Mode: Main Hack & Slash styled video game with some minigames & funny cutscenes.✓ Animal Pets that can actually help to boost your performance (Choose Rammy, trust me)✓ Free DLC if you own The game: Battle - Block Theatre (Sword & Character)✓ Unique swords with lovely designs and unique attributes/ weaknesses✓ Peanut Butter & Jelly Sandwich Steroids✓ Low Price (especially during sales)✓ Achievments & Trading Cards✓ Great Story Development  Also if you look in the background of every level there are Certain things that add on to the Lore of the game   CONS: ✘ Community has decreased in size (due the game being old)✘ The 1 ♥♥♥♥ing Back - off Barbarian Achievement✘ Minimal Horse Riding✘ Infinite Jump Combo (TOO OP IMO)✘ The 2 Paid DLC's don't add too much to the game, just 2 new characters with more swords✘ The Story is kinda short compared to other games✘ Some Repetitive movesets between characters

Posted: October 25, 2016
												CC is one of the best co-op games currently available, there's a story like every other, save the princess blah blah but the levels you come across are amusing and the enemies are for the most part challenging. There is so much replayability to this because once you finish it it just gets harder, like Borderlands, and you can start a new character and continue starting again as much as you like because you won't get bored if you're playing this with friends. If you are alone you probably won't have a grand time.

Posted: October 13, 2016
												The combat and characters are awesome and really fun to play with (finally a king from a video game who actually does somthing to save thier country!). All the enemys and levels are cool and the bosses are fun to fight (especialy the deer/barn chase section).However a problem I had was post-completion content. After you finish the game with one character you can unlock new characters to play with (actually you can do this before completing the game in arenas but that's besides the point). When you unlock the characters, all you can do with them is play the entire game with no differences all over again. What's that? you wan't to unlock ALL the characters? Well good luck  because that means playing the ENTIRE game 7-8 TIMES with different characters AND ABOSLUTELY NO CHANGE IN THE STORY OR GAMPLAY WHATSOEVER (you also play a different mode using a character you've won the game with but it's literally the same thing except the enemys are stronger). I just personally find this really annoying but I know of people who like this format.Aside from the whole "replay with new characters thing" it's a really fun game and actually one of my favourite Behemoth games (but you can't beat Battle Block Theatre).

												a really fun game with funny, quirky and just wtf moments. like when you go into a forest, where animal poop themselves and somehow jet propell themselves with their own faeces. or when you get abducted by alien homnids, and intterupt a large one while he's lifting, which then causes him to self-destruct the ship. and who could forget the moment you ride A MOTHER ♥♥♥♥ING DINOSAUR TO ONE OF THE BEST TRACKS EVER- oh sorry got carried away. overall, the game is fun too, with combo moves, magic and even different weapons and characters, like hatty hattington from battleblock theater, or the mediocre gray knight. the combat system is good, but i tend to juggle enemies. either way. its a good beat 'em up game with memorable moments, fun game modes, and a kickin' soundtrack (JUMPER AND CHAOZ JAPAN ARE THE BEST JUST SAYING). brilliant game for multiplayer with friends *cough* eddie pls *cough*. really reccomended from me, and the other 1 million people who own this gem of a game.

												Simple controls, simpler goals, mini-games, and loads of amusing weapons to collect. This game looks like a joke, and it kind of is -- a hilariously awesome string of trope-mocking trope-usage. The greatness of this game cannot be put into words, nor can the simple joy of playing it. Whether you want to hack and slash alone, with friends, or random people online, this game is just loads of fun. Especially if it goes on sale for cheap, you must crash the castle.

Posted: December 23, 2013
												This game is rather short, and even with a wide array of characters and secrets to find/unlock ultimately boils down for somethig repetitive after playing it for a good while. However, if you're a fan of Hack-and-Slash/Beat em' Up games, I will think that you will have a rather fun time on this game alone, and it's just a blast to play with with a full party of 4, or just with another buddy/brother/whatever. The gameplay is simple and easy to understand, and the the leveling system is in my opinion a lot more friendly than the usual since any and all hits gives you a certain amount of XP. This allows anyone to get stronger even if they're succesful or not with their current area. The bosses are more memorization than reflexes, so while it will be hard on your first tries, it will get much more easier to the point that it may get a little, how should I say boring? To me, anyways. While I do think leveling system is friendly in terms of grinding, I don't think it's friendly for builds. While cool, does not allow for hybrid builds on the get go. You want to max out a certain skill asap, and to me I just don't find much fun in specialization. This game also features a "hard mode" but it really is just enemies with more health for the most part.Finally, this game also got ported rather badly. All tutorials, button inputs are shown to only the 360 setup regardless, and default KB controls were awkward. I don't think it's /awful/ or comparable to others ports like Dark Souls, but I would absolutely reccomend to play this with a 360 control if it's possible. I also think that the default price tag may be a little to much for anyone remotely skeptical, but I do highly suggest giving it a go if you catch it on sale.

Posted: July 5, 2015
												4 player fun!  My 6, 7, and 14 year old children and I have played this together on a number of occasions on our 4 computers.  It's largely cooperative and reminds me of the old Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: The Arcade Game with over the top side-scrolling action.  Players fight over coin and weapon drops while tearing up the AI mobs of enemies.  There is an overview map that you slide along ala Mario 3 to play different stages.  There are pets that you can purchase who follow you on the battlefield and grant you bonuses.  There is a weapon shop where you each choose your favorite weapon.Play with a controller!

Posted: May 8, 2015
												Castle Crashers. Okay, it looks pretty comical, but I assure you, it's just as paced as the next fighting game.Now I want to start off not by listing things that you might already know, but by listing things that you might not know.For example, (and spoilers ahead, you've been warned)You get to kiss a clownJam sandwiches are this game's steroids. Litterally.You fight to the death with your was-comrades over a princess.You get to decapitate enemies with a broccoli stem.You get to ride a pooping deer. Actually, no. A deer that propells itself forward using said feces.One word: Aliens.Also, it's got witty inside-jokes. Thanks, Behemoth!Overall, I'd give an 8/10. If you're looking for some fun with friends, get this game. But be warned, the online community is a bit... empty. Only buy if you have friends.

Posted: July 27, 2014
												OH BOY do i have a lot to say!Let's follow the positive: You start with 4 knights, red, blue, green, and orange knight, each having their own elementred-lightning/electricity, blue-ice, green-posion/acid, orange-fire. You may also upgrade either defense,strength,magic, and agility. Including the skills and the knights, this gives multiplayer lots of possibilities, you can have a level 11 red knight and a level 20 orange knight. but there srent just 4 knights, you can also unlock other knights and also dlc, so it would be hard to call this game repetetive! This is a realistic game like battlefied, more like a cartoony hack and slash, but the visuals are still pleasing. Unfortunately, thats all the positive things i have to say.BUT there arent a lot of negatives, but multiplayer has WAY too much lag. And remember the upgrades? Those are use a skill mechanic, every time you level up, you get 2 skills, but once you reach the level 10 and up, it takes way too long to level up. and no matter what, you will always get only 2 skills, this makes it so that it takes way too long to upgrade, if we were to get 3 or 4 skills once we go over level 10, i wouldnt mind.So there you have it, MY PERSONEL OPINION of castle crasheroverall i think it deserves a 6, 7 or maybe an 8/10, but the multiplayer lag really provents it from getting a 9/10

Posted: August 1, 2014
												You and 3 of your friends looking to play something, but  you're tired of same boring fpses? You want something comedy/adventury? Well, this game could give you that! It's 2D sidescroller sword-em up. It is second The Behemoth's game and it's nicely done for their 3rd project (Because their 2nd project was just HD remake). Yes it has glitches but what games don't? For controls i'd recommend ya using controller. A.I isn't always smart but sometimes it's good, because even with bad A.I. Hordes of enemies can kill ya. The game is reccomended to play with 4 players but you can play it by yourself (which is less interesting because there's some mini-games that can be triggered with 2,3 or 4 players and boss battles are easier) Even DLC's are fair enough, the art style is well fitting with nice set of music. Sometimes the jokes are offtop. (Did i mention shitjokes? That's one of the Cons)8\10

Posted: July 3, 2015
												Dont know what to say about this game so here is a recipe for chicken curryRoughly chop the onion, transfer to a small food processor, and add 3 tablespoons of water - process to a slack paste. You could use a stick blender for this or coarsely grate the onion into a bowl – there’s no need to add any water if you are grating the onion. Tip into a small bowl and leave on one side.Put the chopped garlic and ginger into the same food processor and add 4 tbsp water – process until smooth and spoon into another small bowl. Alternatively, crush the garlic to a paste with a knife or garlic press and finely grate the ginger.Heat the oil in a wok or sturdy pan set over a medium heat. Combine the cumin and fennel seeds with the cinnamon and chilli flakes and add to the pan in one go. Swirl everything around for about 30 secs until the spices release a fragrant aroma.Add the onion paste – it will splutter in the beginning. Fry until the water evaporates and the onions turn a lovely dark golden - this should take about 7-8 mins. Add the garlic and ginger paste and cook for another 2 mins – stirring all the time.Stir in the garam masala, turmeric, and sugar and continue cooking for 20 secs before tipping in the tomatoes. Continue cooking on a medium heat for about 10 mins without a lid until the tomatoes reduce and darken.Cut the chicken thighs into 3cm chunks and add to the pan once the tomatoes have thickened to a paste. Cook for 5 mins to coat the chicken in the masala and seal in the juices, and then pour over the hot chicken stock. Simmer for 8-10 mins without a lid until the chicken is tender and the masala lightly thickened – you might need to add an extra ladleful of stock or water if the curry needs it. Sprinkle with chopped coriander and serve with Indian flatbreads or fluffy basmati rice and a pot of yogurt on the side.

												Great game for everyone, it is quite an addicting game with many characters and many things to upgrade for each character. I would give it an 8/10... well, maybe 9/10. I don't know, it can get boring sometimes - but definitely worth to buy! The developers (The Behemoth) also haven't updated the game for PC yet, the controls guide and new combos are still showed in the controller version, so you'll have to find out the combos by yourself or search it up.

Posted: June 26, 2015
												I am going to be Frank here. I have grown out of mindless games that only is about leveling up and hitting buttons (or keys) as much as possible. I get bored after five minutes with most games like that.A lot of Beat 'Em Up games (which this basically is) are like that. For mostly nostalgic reasons I can now and again play classics like Golden Axe, Final Fight or TMNT: Turtles In Time. But other than that... No. Beat 'Em Up is nothing that interest me anymore.This game though is very enjoyable. There is lots of humor in it. The game never takes itself too seriously which I enjoy. While some humor is very childish I bet most people will laugh at least a few times during the game or smile frequently.It isn't all about hitting buttons either. Whilst not being that difficult there are places where you actually have to use your brain to get through. I like that. The replay vaule is quite big mostly because of two reasons: 1) You can play with up to four people which make the game more fun (but a bit more chaotic). I would say the game is easier alone though in some ways. Which leads me to 2). 2) The system to upgrade your character. There is four elements you can upgrade during the game.. Depending on which you upgrade the game can get easier or harder. It's also fun to choose different strategies. You get experience directly for all hits you do on enemies in the game. So if you friend get fifty hits on an enemy and you one. You still get one experience. It isn't always much.. But it keeps the game in a good flow and is very fair. The more you level up the longer time it takes. Getting all upgrades will definitely demand more than just playing the game through once without going back. Playing alone, you will upgrade faster.From what I noticed the diffculty playing with friends or alone is hardly notable. But there is minor differences like more enemies in different spots. The diffculity goes up and down in the game. Some places you just run through and others will take a few tries. The game is quite long for a Beat 'Em Up but not compared to other genres of games today. You won't finish it in one hour the first time you try it though.. *cough* Final Fight 3 *cough*.All in all. It is a fun game if you want a break from the longer more serious games you got. Comes recommended all the way from Sweden!

												Best game Ever...Nuff said.  Well Almost enough said... I would like to give this game an honest "Review".     Anyways the game at its current state in my OPINION is fantastic I have Beaten The Game on Ps3 and Xbox 360 and working my way on pc at this time! Iff you like 2d Castle Crashing awesomeness then this is a game for you.Gameplay: 2d action while being a knight fighting Barbarians,Ninja Pirates,Skeletons ETC topping that you get stats to upgrade with each level =Magic= =Agility= =Strength= =Defense= all changing over all fun and gameplay Wether you like using a bow magic or sword! ... Or a Shovel! WITH pets that grant you bonuses or even find items for you! And a "heart" touching StoryLineGraphics: Cartoony gorey awesomeness "Nuff Sed"Fighting: This is similar to gameplay but who cares. So although it may a bit difficult on PC its still very fun not to hard to get used to Smacking enemies with a sword shooting people or even Burning someone! Posted: July 27, 2014
												OH BOY do i have a lot to say!Let's follow the positive: You start with 4 knights, red, blue, green, and orange knight, each having their own elementred-lightning/electricity, blue-ice, green-posion/acid, orange-fire. You may also upgrade either defense,strength,magic, and agility. Including the skills and the knights, this gives multiplayer lots of possibilities, you can have a level 11 red knight and a level 20 orange knight. but there srent just 4 knights, you can also unlock other knights and also dlc, so it would be hard to call this game repetetive! This is a realistic game like battlefied, more like a cartoony hack and slash, but the visuals are still pleasing. Unfortunately, thats all the positive things i have to say.BUT there arent a lot of negatives, but multiplayer has WAY too much lag. And remember the upgrades? Those are use a skill mechanic, every time you level up, you get 2 skills, but once you reach the level 10 and up, it takes way too long to level up. and no matter what, you will always get only 2 skills, this makes it so that it takes way too long to upgrade, if we were to get 3 or 4 skills once we go over level 10, i wouldnt mind.So there you have it, MY PERSONEL OPINION of castle crasheroverall i think it deserves a 6, 7 or maybe an 8/10, but the multiplayer lag really provents it from getting a 9/10
